A4.text: The states which use the most natural gas for electricity production are, in descending order, Texas, Florida, California, and New York.

A5.text: With 7,545 billion cubic feet (BCF), the leading gas-producing area in the United States in 2013 was Texas, followed by Pennsylvania (3,259 BCF), and Louisiana (2,407 BCF).

A6.text: Permian Basin (North America) is a basin in the subsurface of the south of the United States, in west Texas and southeast New Mexico.
